text: Graduate Teaching Assistant. Starting date: September 2021. Location: Harrow. Free CPD and Constant support with interviewing. We are looking for a dynamic, experienced and motivated graduates who are looking to make a difference as a Teaching Assistant. The successful candidate will have a passion for education and ideally be looking to teach in the near future. You will be working closely with the SEN department working closely with students who need additional support so any prior experience is highly desired. Experience of working as a teaching assistant (desired). Have an interest in the education sector. A recent graduate (graduated within last 2 years). Ability to engage with and inspire young learners. About the school. A highly successful all-inclusive school with a co-educational offer at post 16. The school pride themselves on a culture of high standards from staff and pupils, they are demanding yet a rewarding school where students and staff feel valued and supported. Role Summary. Your role will be to provide support either in-class, 1:1 tuition or to small groups of students with varying abilities, you will be encouraging and supporting individual pupils to reach their full potential whilst demonstrating a creative and determined attitude that will help motivate students. You will be directly supporting the students, as well as helping to organise the teaching and learning resources available to students and staff. Apply today to be considered for this fantastic opportunity.

  • Graduate Teaching Assistant
  • Starting date: September 2021
  • Location: Harrow
  • Free CPD and Constant support with interviewing

We are looking for a dynamic, experienced and motivated graduates who are looking to make a difference as a Teaching Assistant. The successful candidate will have a passion for education and ideally be looking to teach in the near future.
You will be working closely with the SEN department working closely with students who need additional support so any prior experience is highly desired.

  • Experience of working as a teaching assistant (desired)
  • Have an interest in the education sector
  • A recent graduate (graduated within last 2 years)
  • Ability to engage with and inspire young learners

About the school
A highly successful all-inclusive school with a co-educational offer at post 16.
The school pride themselves on a culture of high standards from staff and pupils, they are demanding yet a rewarding school where students and staff feel valued and supported.

Role Summary
Your role will be to provide support either in-class, 1:1 tuition or to small groups of students with varying abilities, you will be encouraging and supporting individual pupils to reach their full potential whilst demonstrating a creative and determined attitude that will help motivate students.
You will be directly supporting the students, as well as helping to organise the teaching and learning resources available to students and staff.

Apply today to be considered for this fantastic opportunity.
Or call and ask for Daryl.

"}
